intro: Sloanea ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
